page.title: 10Gala Day
page.content:
"WREA GREEN FIELD DAY" is the name given to the local Gala day. It has been held annually for 60 years on the village Green at the end of June. The afternoon starts with a procession of villagers in fancy dress but before the procession starts the entrants are judged and prizes given to the best.
After the first circuit of the Green the Rose Queen is crowned on a small decorated stage. The next event is a Morris dance by the village girls followed by childrens races on the Green. After this is the chidrens tea which is held in the school. The children then go on the fair which has many rides such as the Scrambler, Speedway and Waltzer. An Adult Sports is held in the evening.
